title: UI Scaling on 4K monitor ISSUES
body:
So I purchased a Razer Blade 2016 and I was all excited to play a game of league on the UHD+ screen. Luckily I didn't jump right into a Ranked game and instead fired up an aram game. League has resolution settings for 4K monitors and it looks great, there was so much more detail then when I was playing on my old hp laptop. But there were some UI scaling issues that are honestly ruining playing league.

First, the mouse courser is devastatingly small, when I'm in a team fight or trying to click on a specific minion in a wave it is incredibly easy to lose sight of the courser and not click on the right enemy. How is there not corrected scaling options for this?????

Next, the chat is too tiny to read without squinting, the shop descriptions and icons are equally tiny, and the health bars over everything are also scaled way down to where I can barely tell who has how much health.

But the worst part is that the map becomes completely useless. The map itself is still the same size as it was when i played on my old 1080p laptop, however, on a 2160p (4K) screen the icons representing Champions, towers, drag, and minions, etc. become absolutely tiny that you have to stare at the map to figure out which champ is which.

4K has been becoming more common in monitors and laptops and I've found archived posts from over two years ago stating that they had these same problems. I feel that gamers like to have newer and better equipment, yet Riot seems to be neglecting us. I mean not a single employee has tried it out on a 4K screen and noticed the issues? I cant imagine it would be hard for them to adjust UI scaling for High Res screens. Can anyone tell me why this hasnt been fixed in over two years time??

Also if anyone has any tips for at least fixing some of the scaling problems I would appreciate them.

replies.body:
I can imagine a lot of the UI was designed well before 4K became affordable and applicable for gaming. While there's currently no full support for 4K, we're certainly looking into it.

In the meantime, a lot of players can play on 4K with no issues when running Full Screen and changing the scale of the UI using the in-game settings under **Interface**. I should also mention that if you alt+tab at all during a match when in Full Screen mode, it will completely mess up your UI scaling and will require you to launch back into the match. There's no workaround for this as far as I know.

Let me know if you have any questions.
Any update on this? It's mid  2017 and I still have to connect to a 1080p monitor to play this game.

I set all my interface settings to 100% and I still have the issue of map icons, chat, courser and health bars being about 3 to 4 times smaller then they should be. I'm unsure how to post a picture on here, but i did take a screenshot to show.

Edit: here is a link to a screenshot. I can live with the small chat and shop items, but the small mouse courser and map icons are definite issues. [Link.](https://plus.google.com/103896540818045820859/posts/D9vGjJcnX5q)
Can you send me a screenshot of your Windows DPI and resolution settings along with your VIDEO settings in-game?

Thanks for those screenshots. You may be able to resolve this by either of the steps below:

1) Disable DPI Scaling for League. Right click on the shortcut (cannot be on the taskbar) then hit *properties*. Under the *Compatibility* tab, check the box at the bottom for "Disable DPI Scaling". Screenshot below.

(click to enlarge)

http://imgur.com/a/O4bcZ

2) Change your system DPI from its current 225% back to 100%. Screenshot below.

(click to enlarge)

http://imgur.com/a/lG33W

Let me know if either of these worked.
They both had the same effect, they caused certain things to become very small in the League client, but there were no changes in game.

Gotcha. Unfortunately, as full 4K support hasn't rolled out yet, some things are bound to interact strangely when running League at 4k. The UI scaling seems to be the biggest issue at the moment, but not everyone experiences it. 

As someone excited to build a 4K rig this year, I'm looking forward to full 4K support, though I don't know when that will roll out.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Any updates on this?  My cursor is 2mm x 2mm... Would be nice to just have the option to significantly increase the cursor size at least.  It's so small I can't find what I'm clicking on during busy team fights, etc.

I appreciate you looking into the matter, I didn't know if it was something that could be fixed without an actual patch from Riot, but thanks for trying. The mini map is the biggest issue that I really really hope they release a patch fix for soon.
